member.summary: Represents an entry with no defined significance.

member.summary: Represents an entry with low significance.

member.name: F:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.Significances.Medium
member.summary: Represents an entry with medium significance.

member.name: F:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.Significances.High
member.summary: Represents an entry with high significance.

member.name: F:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.Significances.All
member.summary: Represents an entry with all significance flags set

member.name: T:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.UserActivityLogEntry
member.summary: LogEntry for representing normal user activity.

remarks.para: This LogEntry type should be used to represent normal activity that occurs within a system and is initiated by the user. For example, a log entry could be entered when a user adds or deletes a data record.

This class is serializable to meet the requirments of the logging system for log entries. If updating or extending this class, any properties should either be value typed, or typed as objects that support serialization and derivatives should be properly marked as serializable.

member.name: T:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.LogEntry
member.summary: Abstract class for representing and managing log entry data common to all log entry types.
member.remarks: LogEntry is a serializable property holder. For proper functioning of the logging system, any derived classes implementing a new log entry type must also be serializable. This allows the ability to store any log entry type generically in any destination as XML.

member.name: T:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.ILogEntry
member.summary: Interface for managing EternalPlay.ReusableCore log entry data common to all log entry types.

member.name: M:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.ILogEntry.Route
member.summary: Sends the event log entry to the LoggingManager for routing to all the appropriately configured destinations.

member.name: P:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.ILogEntry.Application
member.summary: Gets and sets the application associated with the log entry
member.remarks: The application is an arbitrary token specified in the logging configuration that allows multiple applications to use the same repositories for persistent logging destinations.

member.name: P:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.ILogEntry.ApplicationVersion
member.summary: Gets a string that represents version information about the application that created the log entry

member.name: P:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.ILogEntry.Category
member.summary: Gets and sets the category associated with the log entry.
member.remarks: The category is an arbitrary token that can be used by consumers of the Logging system to group log entries together. For example all log entries associated with an XML parsing component or sub system could be given a category of XML Parsing, or all entries from user interface layers could be categorized as UI.

member.name: P:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.ILogEntry.CustomData
member.summary: Gets and sets any custom data associated with the log entry.
member.remarks: Custom data is a place for implementing applications to store additional data regarding the log entry, for example the id of an item associated with the entry.

member.name: T:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.UserFeedbackLogEntry
member.summary: LogEntry for representing normal user activity.

remarks.para: This LogEntry type should be used to represent normal activity that occurs within a system and is initiated by the user. For example, a log entry could be entered when a user adds or deletes a data record.

This class is serializable to meet the requirments of the logging system for log entries. If updating or extending this class, any properties should either be value typed, or typed as objects that support serialization and derivatives should be properly marked as serializable.

member.name: T:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.SystemActivityLogEntry
member.summary: LogEntry for representing normal system activity.

remarks.para: This LogEntry type should be used to represent normal activity that occurs and is initiated by the system. For example, a windows service application might use a SystemActivityLogEntry when service state changes, e.g. the service starts or stops.

This class is serializable to meet the requirments of the logging system for log entries. If updating or extending this class, any properties should either be value typed, or typed as objects that support serialization and derivatives should be properly marked as serializable.

member.summary: Writes the given log entry to the destination.
member.param: LogEntry to persist.
member.remarks: This method encapsulates veryfing configuration information before acutally calling the method to write the method to the destination, which is an abstract method implemented by the deriving type.

member.name: P:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.DestinationWriter.HandlesAllCategories
member.summary: Gets a boolean, true indicates that all categories will be processed by the current instance.
member.remarks: This property checks to see if the CategoriesHandled collection is in the default state containing no categories. This state indicates that all categories are handled. This property is the equivelent of the logical comparison: CategoriesHandled.Count == 0.

member.name: P:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.DestinationWriter.HandlesAllLogEntryTypes
member.summary: Gets a boolean, true indicates that all log entry types will be processed by the current instance.
member.remarks: This property checks to see if the LogEntryTypesHandled collection is in the default state containing no log entry types. This state indicates that all log entry types are handled. This property is the equivelent of the logical comparison: LogEntryTypesHandled.Count == 0.

member.name: P:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.DestinationWriter.CategoriesHandled
member.summary: Gets a list of category values that will be processed by the current instance.
member.remarks: This property defaults to an empty list, signifying that all categories are handled.

member.name: P:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.DestinationWriter.LogEntryTypesHandled
member.summary: Gets a list of Type values representing the log entry types that will be processed by the current instance.
member.remarks: This property defaults to an empty list, signifying that all categories are handled.

member.name: P:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.DestinationWriter.SignificancesHandled
member.summary: Gets the Significances flags defining which log entry significances will be processed by the current intsance.
member.remarks: This property defaults to the flag set defined by Significances.All.

member.name: T:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.UserErrorLogEntry
member.summary: LogEntry for representing error conditions generated by a user.

remarks.para: This LogEntry type should be used to represent invalid activity that occurs within a system and is initiated by the user. For example, a log entry could be entered when a user attempts to enter string data in a numerical field or omits a required item when attempting to add data record.

This class is serializable to meet the requirments of the logging system for log entries. If updating or extending this class, any properties should either be value typed, or typed as objects that support serialization and derivatives should be properly marked as serializable.

member.name: T:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.LoggingManager
member.summary: Class exposing static methods for managing log entries.

remarks.para: The LoggingManager exposes static methods for using Logging within an application. The primary method for logging is RouteLogEntry.

Internally LoggingManager is implemented as a thread-safe singleton. The singelton pattern allows logging configuration data to be loaded and managed only one time in a single instance. The static methods can then use this configuration data without exposing the management of that configuration data to external users.

To ensure the usability of this EternalPlay.ReusableCore component infrastructure in all application types, the EternalPlay.ReusableCore logging classes will be designed and implemented in a thread-safe way where possible. The ability to make a singleton class thread safe has some complications specific to the implementation pattern and to the .NET framework as well. More information on thread safety requirments for the singleton pattern within .NET can be obtained from the MSDN Library

member.name: M:EternalPlay.ReusableCore.Logging.LoggingManager.#ctor

remarks.para: This constructor is marked as private so that LoggingManager instances can only be instantiated internally by the private code responsible for ensuring that only one instance of LoggingManager exists.
